name: Dahi Bhalla
history: Dahi Bhalla, also known as Dahi Vada, is a popular snack in Indian cuisine. It consists of fried lentil dumplings (vadas), soaked in thick yogurt (dahi) and topped with various spices and chutneys, offering a blend of creamy, tangy, and spicy flavors.
description: Dahi Bhalla is a delightful Indian dish where soft vadas made from lentil batter are immersed in sweet and tangy yogurt, then garnished with savory spices, tangy tamarind chutney, and refreshing mint chutney. It's a favorite at festivals and celebrations.

instructions.title: Prepare the Vada Batter
instructions.description: Grind the soaked urad dal into a smooth batter, adding very little water. The batter should be thick and fluffy. Add salt to taste.

instructions.title: Fry the Vadas
instructions.description: Heat oil in a deep frying pan. Drop spoonfuls of the batter into the hot oil and fry the vadas until golden brown. Remove and drain excess oil.

instructions.title: Soak the Vadas
instructions.description: Soak the fried vadas in warm water for about 20-30 minutes. Then, gently press the vadas to remove excess water and keep them aside.

instructions.title: Prepare the Yogurt Mixture
instructions.description: In a mixing bowl, whisk the yogurt with a little water to make it smooth. Add sugar if desired.

instructions.title: Assemble the Dahi Bhalla
instructions.description: Place the soaked vadas in the yogurt mixture. Sprinkle cumin powder, red chili powder, and chaat masala over the vadas. Drizzle with tamarind and mint chutney.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Serve the Dahi Bhalla chilled as a snack or appetizer.

tips: Soaking the vadas in water makes them soft and helps them absorb the yogurt better.
Adjust the spices and chutneys according to your taste preferences.
variations: Add grated cucumber or boiled potatoes to the yogurt for additional texture.
Garnish with pomegranate seeds or sev (crispy noodle-like snack) for extra crunch.

storage.shelfLife: Best consumed immediately. Can be refrigerated for up to 1 day.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

presentationTips: Serve in individual bowls, garnished with extra chutney and spices.
Accompany with a side of crispy papad or naan bread.
